doc.previous: The only known predator of the fin whale is the killer whale with at least twenty eyewitness and second hand accounts of attack or harassment They usually flee and offer little resistance to attack Only a couple confirmed fatalities have occurred In October 2005 sixteen killer whales attacked and killed a fin whale in the Canal de Ballenas Gulf of California after chasing it for about an hour They fed on its sinking carcass for about 15 minutes before leaving the area In June 2012 a pod of killer whales was seen in La Paz Bay in the Gulf of California chasing a fin whale for over an hour before finally killing it and feeding on its carcass The whale bore numerous tooth rakes over its back and dorsal fin several killer whales flanked it on either side with one individual visible underwater biting at its right lower jaw 97 In July 1908 a whaler reportedly saw two killer whales attack and kill a fin whale off western Greenland In January 1984 seven were seen from the air circling holding the flippers and ramming a fin whale in the Gulf of California but the observation ended at nightfall 98 99
